translated: The Elder’s Birth Story of the Perception of the Buddha
“When Vipassī, the Foremost in the World,

analyzed: otatam vitthatam mayha  suvi citta vaṭasaka
translated: the earth with its swamps and moats.🔽My dwelling shook,
as the Buddha’s life-force was exhausted.
‘What is the purpose of this arising?
There is no danger to living beings,
Oh, the perfection of our Teacher!
I rejoiced in heaven for an eon;
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the perception of the Buddha.
I was a king named Patāpavā;
… and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus has it been heard by the Elder Buddhasaññaka.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā buddhasaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Buddhasaññakattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā buddhasaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽buddhasaññaka therassa apadānam sattama
translated: The Story of the Elder Buddhasaññaka is finished.
